segments.text: The kitchen is bustling with activity, yet it feels so calm outside the window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a perfect day in the garden, but here, chaos reigns.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the woman focused on her dish, unaware of the water flowing freely behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost comical how she doesn’t notice the puddle forming at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool has his eyes set only on the cookie jar, oblivious to the danger below him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a little disgusted by the way they’re sneaking cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Is this how children learn? Through little acts of rebellion?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s poised stance makes her seem like she’s in on the secret, anticipating her reward.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could shout out to them, but I’m frozen, just watching it unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their excitement is palpable, and I can’t help but smile despite my worries.
segments.speaker: PAR
